info:
The main goal of the proposed program loan (PL) is to support the Government in its policy and institutional reforms to further poverty reduction and maintain high economic growth, as envisaged in the Government's 5-Year Socioeconomic and Development Plan (SEDP) 2006-2010. The SEDP is considered to be the national poverty reduction strategy paper that is results-based, outcome-oriented, monitorable, and widely consulted. The PL is to provide support for implementation of the Government poverty reduction program within the policy framework of the Sixth Poverty Reduction Support Credit (PRSC 6). 

The scope of the PL includes:

(i) To promote growth and create employment by (a) increasing internal and external competition, (b) improving efficiency and resource allocation in the economy, (c) strengthening its regulatory framework for the private sector development, and (d) enhancing transparency and accountability in SOE operations and in the financial sector; 

(ii) To advance human development by (a) upgrading the quality of education, (b) promoting inclusive education for children with disadvantages, (c) improving access of the poor to the health services, (d) helping secure asset ownership of the citizens, (e) addressing inequalities in health and education outcomes across regions and population groups, and (f) encouraging important policy measures leading to more sustainable management of natural resources; and 

(iii) To increase transparency and accountability of public finances as well as improve legal transparency and accessibility by (a) promoting greater accountability in public finance and public administration as part of a broader effort to build modern governance, (b) improving coordination between 5-Year plans and budget formulation, and (c) supporting the government's comprehensive and ambitious agenda of its Legal System Development Strategy.
name: SUPPORT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE POVERTY REDUCTION PROGRAM IV
